title: How to Curl Hair with Chopsticks

steps.headline: Wash your hair.
steps.description: Lather up some shampoo and massage it into the scalp for a minute or two to promote blood flow. Saturate the ends of the hair with conditioner and leave it for five to ten minutes before rinsing out.

steps.headline: Remove knots and tangles.
steps.description: Start combining the hair from the bottom to the top with a wide tooth comb to remove knotted hair.

steps.headline: Grab some chopsticks.
steps.description: The amount of chopsticks needed depends on how curly you want your hair to be. Use more chopsticks for voluminous tight curls and fewer chopsticks for loose curls.

steps.headline: Wrap your hair around the chopstick.
steps.description: Grab a big or small section of hair and twirl it around the chopstick just like you would with a normal curling iron.

steps.headline: Secure with a clip or a small hair tie.
steps.description: Once the hair is around the chopstick, use a hair tie or hair clip to prevent it from unraveling.

steps.headline: Continue throughout the entire head.
steps.description: Repeat the process until all the hair is wrapped with chopsticks.

steps.headline: Allow to dry.
steps.description: If you decide to wait overnight, wear something to protect the hair. Be extremely cautious as the hair may unravel; you can also wait by doing chores around the house.

steps.headline: Remove the chopsticks.
steps.description: Once the hair is completely dry, remove the chopsticks gently by taking out the tie or clip. Continue this process until all the chopsticks are out of the hair.

steps.headline: Style your hair and add accessories.
steps.description: Use any desired hair products and decide how you want to rock your new curls by leaving your hair down. Do a high pony, part your hair or even do a "half up, half down" style or add a pretty bow.

steps.headline: Heat a flat iron.
steps.description: Plug in a flat iron and wait until it's hot enough to use.

steps.headline: Wrap your hair around the chopstick.
steps.description: Grab a big or small section of hair, then twirl it around the chopstick just like you would with a normal curling iron.

steps.headline: Press the flat iron onto the wrapped hair.
steps.description: Hold the flat iron onto the hair for a few seconds, making sure all the hair has been touched by the flat iron.

steps.headline: Gently remove the chopstick.
steps.description: Pull the chopstick carefully out of the hair.

steps.headline: Continue until all hair is curled.
steps.description: Repeat the same process throughout the whole head.

steps.headline: Style as usual.
steps.description: Use any desired hair products to achieve your wanted look.
